staticElectricity.question: What is static electricity?
options: The flow of electrical charges in one direction
The buildup of electrical charges on the surface of an object
The result of a balance between negative and positive charges in an object
A phenomenon in which positive charges are transferred from one object to another
staticElectricity.answer: The buildup of electrical charges on the surface of an object

staticElectricity.question: The overall charge on an object is neutral when the number of positive charges is ________ the number of negative charges.
A glass rod becomes negatively charged after being rubbed with a woolen cloth because...
options: The negative charges are free to move about in the rod
The number of negative charges is distributed evenly in the rod
It has gained negative charges from the woolen cloth
It has lost negative charges to the woolen cloth
staticElectricity.answer: It has gained negative charges from the woolen cloth

staticElectricity.question: What type of electrical charges move from one surface of an object to another to form a static charge?
What happens when two plastic rods with negative charges come close to each other?
options: The rods react with each other to make a spark

staticElectricity.question: Which of the following are examples of static electricity?
Somsri uses a plastic comb to comb her dry hair. She then places the comb near some tiny pieces of paper. What will she observe?
options: The comb has no effect on the pieces of paper
The pieces of paper are attracted to each other
The comb attracts the pieces of paper
The comb repels the pieces of paper
staticElectricity.answer: The comb attracts the pieces of paper

staticElectricity.question: What happens when a balloon is rubbed with a cloth?
options: The positive charges on the balloon move to the cloth
The positive charges on the cloth move to the balloon
The negative charges on the cloth move to the balloon
All the positive and negative charges on the cloth move to the balloon
staticElectricity.answer: The negative charges on the cloth move to the balloon

staticElectricity.question: Two balloons are rubbed with a wool cloth and are placed close to each other. Why do the balloons repel each other?
options: They receive opposite charges from the cloth

staticElectricity.question: Two objects with _______ repel each other.
options: A positive charge and a negative charge

staticElectricity.question: A charged object has an excess of negative charges. What is its overall charge?
Which of the following will attract each other?
options: A charged object and a neutral object
A positively charged object and a negatively charged object

staticElectricity.question: Mali combs her hair with a comb. Her hair is dry. She notices the strands of her hair repel each other. What type of force is involved?
What can we do to make an object electrically charged?
options: Put it near to a neutral glass rod
Wipe it with a wet cloth
